I'd like to use a reaction mechanism converted from ck format to cti
using =
ck2cti.exe, except I am having trouble implementing the
mechanism as an obj=
ect through Matlab. This is probably a simple
question, but I am a new Cant=
era user so please bear with me!

The Matlab tutorials show that I can..

>=
 gas1 =3D GRI30

.. and the GRI30.cti will be loaded as an object, I can de=
fine it's
characteristics, equilibrate, etc.  Alternatively I can..

> gas1=
 =3D importPhase('GRI30.cti','GRI30')

.. and similarly it will be loaded a=
s an object.

For certain other .cti mechanisms included with Cantera I can=
 load the
object, but for others I cannont. For example...

> gas1 =3D impo=
rtPhase('Argon.cti','Argon')

.. will load the mechanism as an object, but.=
.  

> gas1 =3D importPhase('h2o2.cti','h2o2')

.. returns a nasty error th=
at I don't really understand..

*******************************************=
*****
                Cantera Error!                  
********************=
****************************


Procedure: xml_find_id
Error:   id not found=
: h2o2

Error in =3D=3D> XML_Node.findByID at 4
index =3D ctmethods(10, 8, =
root.id, id);

Error in =3D=3D> Solution.Solution at 34
  node =3D findByID=
(doc,id);

Error in =3D=3D> importPhase at 7
  s =3D Solution(file, name);
=



.. So I've created a .cti mechanism "octane.cti", converted by way of
ck=
2cti.exe, and it's saved with the other .cti mechanisms in
C:\...\Cantera\d=
ata. I want to load it as an object and run
equilibrium calculations for a =
range of mixtures.  So when I attempt
to (similar to the tutorial for gri30=
)..

> gas1 =3D octane 

??? Undefined function or variable 'octane'

.. an=
d when I ..

> gas1 =3D importPhase('octane.cti','octane')


**************=
**********************************
                Cantera Error!          =
        
************************************************


Procedure: xml_=
find_id
Error:   id not found: octane

Error in =3D=3D> XML_Node.findByID a=
t 4
index =3D ctmethods(10, 8, root.id, id);

Error in =3D=3D> Solution.Sol=
ution at 34
  node =3D findByID(doc,id);

Error in =3D=3D> importPhase at 7=

  s =3D Solution(file, name);

.. So what am I missing? I'm guessing I jus=
t don't yet fully
understand the fundamentals of how Cantera functions, but=
 I haven't
found any documentation that expains this situation. Thanks for =
the help!

Namaste,
Jonathan
